docs.snippet: Anthony Seratelli, 31, is trying to make the opening-day roster as a utility man, but he has played poorly this spring and faces an uncertain future....
docs.lead_paragraph: Anthony Seratelli, 31, is trying to make the opening-day roster as a utility man, but he has played poorly this spring and faces an uncertain future.
docs.abstract: Anthony Seratelli, having toiled for seven years in the Kansas City Royals' farm system, is trying to make the New York Mets' opening-day roster as a utility man; 31-year-old Seratelli has played poorly during spring training and faces uncertain future with team.

headline.main: After Years in Minors, a Met Has Tenuous Hope of Making the Cut
headline.print_headline: After Years in Minors, a Met Has Tenuous Hope of Making the Cut

docs.snippet: After sustaining an injury and then dealing with an embarrassing legal issue, pitcher Michael Pineda on Tuesday was named to the Yankees starting rotation....
docs.lead_paragraph: After sustaining an injury and then dealing with an embarrassing legal issue, pitcher Michael Pineda on Tuesday was named to the Yankees starting rotation.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees name pitcher Michael Pineda fifth in starting rotation; move represents second chance for Pineda, who has struggled with injury and embarrassing legal issues following drunk driving arrest; other MLB news noted.

headline.main: In Second Chance, Pineda Is Named the Yankees’ Fifth Starter
headline.print_headline: In Second Chance, Pineda Is Named the Fifth Starter

docs.snippet: The Los Angeles Dodgers ended the Yankees’ 15-year streak as baseball’s biggest spenders with a projected payroll of $235 million. The Yankees are second at $204 million....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Dodgers ended the Yankees’ 15-year streak as baseball’s biggest spenders with a projected payroll of $235 million. The Yankees are second at $204 million.
docs.abstract: Los Angeles Dodgers end New York Yankees' 15-year streak as baseball's biggest spenders, projecting payroll of $235 million; other baseball news noted.

docs.snippet: Recently discovered newsreel footage captures the day Babe Ruth returned to the Yankee lineup in 1925 — and the first of 2,130 consecutive games by a guy named Gehrig....
docs.lead_paragraph: Recently discovered newsreel footage captures the day Babe Ruth returned to the Yankee lineup in 1925 — and the first of 2,130 consecutive games by a guy named Gehrig.
docs.abstract: Recently discovered newsreel footage captures the day Babe Ruth returned to the New York Yankees lineup in 1925 after a long illness that kept him out of first 41 games of season; footage also features pinch-hitting appearance by Lou Gherig that became the first of his 2,130 consecutive games.

headline.seo: Footage Offers Rare Look at Babe Ruth and Lou Gehrig
headline.main: Capturing a Piece of Yankee History
headline.print_headline: Capturing a Piece of Yankee History
